intro: Koellia montana, commonly known as the mountain koellia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Koellia montana thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations.
